name: Nuisance Algal Growth
functionStatement: Shade, solar input, and groundwater keep temperature and light within natural ranges for stream metabolism and dissolved oxygen.
descriptionMarkdown: Moderate growth matches local light regime, unless historically high/low (e.g., blackwater).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Estimate percent algal cover or use chlorophyll or periphyton data where available and interpret with nutrients and shade context.

inputs.label: Nuisance Algal Growth
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Minimal algae and no nuisance mats. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slightly elevated algal coverage. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Large mats that partially impair habitat. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Dense bloom or scum that covers substrate. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: EPA Water Quality Portal (chlorophyll-a, periphyton where available)

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: Dense bloom or scum that covers substrate.

bin2.name: Fair
bin2.desc: Slightly elevated algal coverage. / Large mats that partially impair habitat.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: Minimal algae and no nuisance mats.
